item.title: Thoughts on Responding to Change
item.description: I love the agile manifesto, one of the things that most drew me to it was “Responding to change over following a plan”. I’ve worked on enough projects to see the benefit in changing direction when it’s clear that your plan isnt going to help you hit your goal and the sheer grinding death march expereince for teams when that doesn’t happen. However the manifesto doesnt say much about different types of change and how best to respond to them, I have 3 metal models of change that I’ve seen in teams. I thought I would share as this is fairly early thinking (for me). I’m interested if others have seen these patterns, and what other models I’ve missed.
